page.title: 14 SHALDON - A TIDY VILLAGE?
page.content: While travelling around the area we took special note of the state of roads and pavements. Most of the roads in the Ringmore area were tarmaced as were the pavements. As a result these surfaces were uneven and the pavements were difficult to walk on. We noticed that there were very few litter bins in Shaldon. In spite of this the village was virtually litter free. Many of the tourists in the area commented on this fact. The only real litter in the area was provided by the dog population who left plenty of evidence of their prescence on the pavements and roads. We came to the conclusion that the human populaton of Shaldon were on the whole a tidy group and if only the dog population could be likewise then Shaldon would be in the running for the title of tidiest village in England.
